questions.question: What is the main application of double-walled metal–dipyrazolate frameworks mentioned in the text?
questions.answer: The main application of double-walled metal–dipyrazolate frameworks mentioned in the text is for the trace removal of benzene vapour.

questions.question: Which specific metal–dipyrazolate framework is highlighted for its performance in capturing trace levels of benzene?
questions.answer: BUT-55 is highlighted for its performance in capturing trace levels of benzene.

questions.question: What drives the tight binding of benzene in BUT-55 according to the text?
questions.answer: C–H···X interactions drive the tight binding of benzene in BUT-55.

questions.question: True or False: BUT-55 cannot be regenerated after capturing benzene.
questions.answer: False

questions.question: What is the benzene uptake range for BUT-53 to BUT-58 at <10 Pa and 298 K?
questions.answer: The benzene uptake range for BUT-53 to BUT-58 at <10 Pa and 298 K is 2.47–3.28 mmol g−1.

questions.question: How is the performance of BUT-55 in benzene capture affected by humidity?
questions.answer: BUT-55 performs well even under humid conditions, with a relatively small effect on its benzene adsorption performance.

questions.question: True or False: The benzene-loaded phase of BUT-55 shows a structural change triggered by benzene loading.
questions.answer: False

questions.question: What method is used to determine the residual benzene in effluent streams flowing through a BUT-55 packed bed?
questions.answer: Gas chromatography mass spectrometry (GC–MS) is used to determine the residual benzene in effluent streams flowing through a BUT-55 packed bed.

questions.question: True or False: BUT-55 and BUT-58 have the same chemical composition and are supramolecular isomers.
questions.answer: True

questions.question: What is the effect of cyclohexane and ethanol on the benzene adsorption performance of BUT-55?
questions.answer: The presence of cyclohexane and ethanol has a minor effect on the benzene adsorption performance of BUT-55.

questions.question: True or False: The adsorption capacity of BUT-55 for benzene decreases significantly in the presence of cyclohexane and ethanol.
questions.answer: False

questions.question: What is the role of acetic acid in the synthesis of BUT-53 to BUT-58?
questions.answer: Acetic acid acts as a modulator in some cases during the synthesis of BUT-53 to BUT-58.

questions.question: True or False: All BUT-53 to BUT-58 frameworks exhibit the same space group.
questions.answer: False

questions.question: What is the significance of the breakthrough experiments conducted on BUT-53 to BUT-58?
questions.answer: The breakthrough experiments conducted on BUT-53 to BUT-58 evaluate their performance in capturing trace benzene from ambient air.

questions.question: True or False: The benzene adsorption capacity of BUT-55 improves after exposure to moisture for one week.
questions.answer: False

questions.question: What is the main challenge in detecting the concentration of benzene in effluent streams as mentioned in the text?
questions.answer: The main challenge is the very low concentration of benzene in effluent streams, requiring sensitive detection methods like GC-MS.

questions.question: True or False: The adsorption of benzene by BUT-55 is primarily driven by electrostatic interactions.
questions.answer: False

questions.question: What experimental technique is used to analyze the crystal structure of benzene-loaded BUT-55?
questions.answer: Single-crystal X-ray diffraction (SCXRD) is used to analyze the crystal structure of benzene-loaded BUT-55.

questions.question: True or False: The adsorption isotherms for BUT-53 to BUT-58 were collected under the same equilibrium conditions.
questions.answer: True

questions.question: What is the impact of ligand substitution on the framework structure and pore size of BUT-53 to BUT-58?
questions.answer: Ligand substitution impacts the pore size and chemistry, as well as benzene adsorption, but does not change the double-walled framework structure.
